intro: Klasea quinquefolia, commonly known as five-leafed klasea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of North America. It is characterized by its distinctive five-lobed leaves that are often arranged in a palmate pattern. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas. Klasea quinquefolia is often found growing along stream banks and in damp forest understories.
